data.question: What reaction is observed in a number of solids according to the text?
What is the role of UV light and heat in the context of the cyclobutane ring?
data.answer: UV light and heat are used for the cleavage of the cyclobutane ring into olefins.

data.question: Is the reversible cleavage of a cyclobutane ring thermally stable?
What material retains its single-crystal nature during reversible processes?
What influences the retention of single-crystal nature in the material?
data.answer: The packing of molecules, controlled by kinetics and thermodynamics.

data.question: Are the photoemissive properties of the products dependent on the crystal packing?
What is the chemical formula for the metal–organic salt mentioned?
What is the result of UV irradiation of single crystals of 1·2 H2O?
Does the dehydration of hydrated crystals show a reversible SCSC [2+2] reaction?
What structure does high-temperature synthesis produce in K2SDC?
What is the effect of recrystallization temperature on K2SDC?
data.answer: It produces two types of products with parallel or herringbone arrangement of the SDC ligands.

data.question: Is the thermal stability of K2SDC and its polymorphs high?
What is the conversion percentage of the [2+2] cycloaddition reaction in 1·2 H2O?
Can prolonged UV irradiation achieve complete photoconversion?
What is the maximum conversion percentage achieved by UV irradiation of 1?
Is the thermal cleavage of cyclobutane rings reversible in a coordination polymer?
What does the SCSC transformation from 1 a to 2 a under UV light indicate?
Does the herringbone structure of K2SDC contribute to maintaining its single-crystal nature under harsh conditions?
What is the photochemical conversion percentage observed crystallographically for 2 a?
Does the control of recrystallization temperature affect the physical properties of the material?
data.answer: The control of recrystallization temperature affects not only the structure packing and single crystal stability but also the physical properties.
